revised_title: Specific Inductive Capacity of Dielectrics and Liquids
tldr: The author conducted experiments to determine the specific inductive capacity of various dielectrics and liquids using modified methods of experimentation. They tested materials such as colza oil, olive oil, raw linseed oil, castor oil, ether, bisulfide of carbon, amylene, benzol, toluol, xylol, and cymol. The specific inductive capacity of these materials was found to be different, and the author discussed the results and compared them with previous research.
